question.title: Maven compatibility Issue Java 21
question.body:
I am trying to build a Java Spring Boot project for my staging environment.

I am using Java 21 on Ubuntu System (Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS)

When executing my following staging shell script

   #!/bin/bash

cd ./

# Log Java and Maven versions for debugging
echo "Java version:"
java -version

echo "Maven version:"
mvn -v

# Install Maven if not already installed
if ! [ -x "$(command -v mvn)" ]; then
  sudo apt-get update
  sudo apt-get install maven -y
fi

# Install the AWS CLI if not already installed
if ! [ -x "$(command -v aws)" ]; then
  sudo apt-get update
  sudo apt-get install awscli -y
fi

# Build API
mvn clean package -Pstaging -e

# Check the build status
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "API successfully built"

else
  echo "Failed to build API"
fi

exit

I get the following error

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.11.0:compile (default-compile) on project api: Fatal error compiling: error: release version 21 not supported -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.11.0:compile (default-compile) on project api: Fatal error compiling
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.doExecute2 (MojoExecutor.java:333)

Failed to build API

I have double-checked my Intellij IDE setting and can't find the problem any suggestions where to look?

Java Compiler

Maven Settings

Project Settings

Project SDK

When running mvn -v

My pom.xml

    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
